body:
Some prior art for configurable reporting styles in Atrium:

https://github.com/robstoll/atrium/blob/v0.7.0/README.md#reporterbuilder.

The rationale of the error message design was to follow how the assertion read where actual comes in before expected, but you are raising a fair point.

I'm happy with the `Expecting: <expected>, but was: <actual>. ` suggestion or better with displaying both values on different for ease of comparison (when you don't have IDEs visual comparison). 

I think it only applies for `isEqualTo` though, for example `isBefore` error message looks like:
```
Expecting:
  <2011-01-01T00:00:00.000>
to be strictly before:
  <2012-01-01T00:00:00.000>
```
which seems fine to me.

Thoughts  on that latter error message ?

I also found it difficult to process that format of the error message when I started to use the library. I'm still not completely get used to it (after a couple of months of usage).

For the latter I would prefer something like this:
```
Actual:
  <2011-01-01T00:00:00.000>
is not strictly before:
  <2012-01-01T00:00:00.000>
```
Although, I agree, it is somewhat easier to process in the original format, than the original message of `isEqualTo`.
@martin-tarjanyi I agree your error message is clearer, it's not top priority  though for me but contributions accepected ;-)

issue.title: Fixes: #1324 Assertion error message sequencing

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
#### Check List:
* Fixes #1324 
* Unit tests :  Yes
* Javadoc with a code example (API only) :  NA

Minor fix, which replaces actual and expected parameter to be more rational in error message

body:
We will start with the equals error message since it's the most used by far.
We will align it to Idea and Truth with:
```
expected: foo 
but was : bar
```

issue.title: Add actual after Expecting to disambiguate error messages

labels.name: status: ideal for contribution
labels.description: An issue that a contributor can help us with

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
#### Summary

Add "actual" after "Expecting" in error message to make it clear the value displayed is actual and not expected


This is related to a comment from https://github.com/assertj/assertj-core/issues/1324:

>     Accordingly, when I begin reading that assertion error message my mind is, well, expecting to see "Expecting: <expected>", not "Expecting: <actual>". It's only when I read the closing, "but was not" that I realize I've interpreted the whole error message backwards.


#### Example

Before:
```
Expecting:
  2011-01-01T00:00:00.000 (java.util.Date)
to be strictly after:
  2012-01-01T00:00:00.000 (java.util.Date)
```

After:
```
Expecting actual:
  2011-01-01T00:00:00.000 (java.util.Date)
to be strictly after:
  2012-01-01T00:00:00.000 (java.util.Date)
```

#### Scope

There are quite a lot of error messages to amend, here's the list:

- [ ] ClassModifierShouldBe
- [ ] ConditionAndGroupGenericParameterTypeShouldBeTheSame
- [ ] OptionalDoubleShouldHaveValueCloseToOffset
- [ ] OptionalDoubleShouldHaveValueCloseToPercentage
- [ ] OptionalShouldContain
- [ ] OptionalShouldContainInstanceOf
- [ ] ShouldAccept
- [ ] ShouldBe
- [ ] ShouldBeAbsolutePath
- [ ] ShouldBeAbstract
- [ ] ShouldBeAfter
- [ ] ShouldBeAfterOrEqualTo

- [ ] ShouldBeBetween
